ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to view the Ottoman Empire in a cultural context
I learned about the history of the Ottoman Empire and the development of its historiography.
Learned about the history of the Ottoman Empire. Learned how to write a historiography paper.

I gained a lot of knowledge on the 600-year history of the Ottoman empire, including territorial gains, administrative systems and reforms, cultural and social developments, and historiography surrounding the empire.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thought the teaching was strong. Maybe could do with a more stable path in the course

It could focus more on the history aspect. I was expecting a survey lecture course on the history of the Ottoman Empire and instead foudn a fairly in-depth course on the historiography of it. It would have been a great course for someone with prior knowledge about the Ottoman Empire, but it was a bit of a struggle for someone like me who was coming in with no knowledge. Nonetheless, I still learned a lot about the history and enjoyed class a lot.

Strengths: interesting content, great professor and TA, reasonable workload. Weakness: content could have focused on more mainstream things (e.g. diplomatic, military, political history), sometimes became a bit too niche.

Strengths: excellent survey course, interesting readings and topics focused on each week, it's simply rare to find Ottoman history offered as a class.
Weaknesses: professor's lectures at times hard to follow without slides

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I really enjoyed this course
Yes, but keep in mind that having prior background knowledge about the Ottoman Empire will greatly enrich your experience. If not, it is still a good class, but might be confusing at certain points.
Yes, very interesting and gives solid survey of the Ottoman Empire.
I had a great time in this course! Professor Taylan Cakmak is very nice, the assignments were interesting, and it's simply really hard to find Ottoman history offered on a curriculum anywhere.
